title: Why does a neon molecule have only one atom? - Quora

response.answer_text: Neon Atomic number =10 No. Of electrons=10 Electronic Configuration = K L M 2 ,8 As Neon has octet of electrons in its valence shell, it has no tendency to form bonds either it with other atoms or with its own atoms.

Because Neon needs some ‘effin space. All the other atoms out there are mean to Neon as she has nothing to offer nor to ask. Hope she would find someone to fill her octets. Until then just leave her alone!
